column4: Hello! How do I install a .deb file? I've tried using the gdebi-gtk. But it complains about some dependency. I still wishes to try my luck and install it anyways. How do I do that?

It turns out that my .deb package depends on a number of libs that I don't have. Or rather, I have them, but older versions of them. That leaves me two questions: 1) is it possible to force an install anyways. 2) is it fruitful to force it, or will the application be broken due to old libs?
Your .deb-Package depend on special Libs. If you don't install this libs, your Progs dont go. It's possible but not good to do so
It is planner 0.14.3. It is available for intrepid. Im on 8.04..
I understand. Now you want install the new version
Than you have to install all the new libs by hand. But it is a bad bad game. A better solution is you compile all by hand from source than. I would wait ;-)
I'm considering that too. Problem is that the current version contains a show-stopper bug. :-)
The current installed Version? Or the new version?
according the planner's change list, the bug has been adressed in the intrepid-version (0.14.3)
I read the Changelogs.... reading... reading...
Only way i see without destroy the package-DB, is to install it from sources.
you ever do something like this?
